Class Theater

  • java.lang.Object
    • Theater
  • public class Theater
extends java.lang.Object
    Objects of this class represent theaters in a given cinema. It describes how many seats exist in the theater, and in how many rows they are organized.
    Version:
    2023.05.01
    Author:
    Artemis MacDuffie

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      int getNumber()
      Returns the theater's assigned number.
      int getRows()
      Returns the number of rows in this theater.
      int getSeats()
      Returns the number of seats per row for this theater.
      void setRows​(int rows)
      Sets the number of rows in this theater.
      void setSeats​(int seats)
      Sets the number of seats per row for this theater.

        public Theater​(int number,
               int rows,
               int seats)
        Constructor for objects of class Theater.
        Parameters:
        number - The number assigned to the theater to distinguish it from others.
        rows - The number of rows of seats in this theater.
        seats - The number of seats per row for this theater.
